thread.title: Cross Country: Vineland boys, Millville girls win county
thread.title_full: Cross Country: Vineland boys, Millville girls win county

title: Cross Country: Vineland boys, Millville girls win county
text:
Cross Country: Vineland boys, Millville girls win county JOSH FRIEDMAN, @JFriedman57 10:19 a.m. EDT October 23, 2015 Vineland's Zach Carbonara (bottom) celebrates with teammate Harrison Mayo after the Fighting Clan captured the Cumberland County boys' cross country championship on Thursday. (Photo: Joe Lamberti/Staff Photographer) 54 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
VINELAND - Teammates Harrison Mayo and Jordan Pitt were side by side, leading late in the Cumberland County Cross Country Championships on Thursday when they took a peek behind them. 
“It was all of our guys right behind us,” Mayo said of the Vineland High School boys’ squad. “I was like, we got this.” 
Mayo, one of four seniors on the Fighting Clan, eventually pulled away from Pitt to capture his second straight individual championship at Cumberland County College. His victory also paced Vineland’s first-through-fifth sweep, as the program earned its first team title since 2011. 
“It all came down to this,” said Mayo, who crossed the finish line in 17 minutes, 27.59 seconds. “We’ve been wanting this since I was a freshman, and I’ve had these guys right behind me. … This was our year. This was something we really wanted and we finally did it.” 
Millville’s McKenzie Springsteadah had a similar feeling earlier in the day when she turned around during the final stretch of the girls’ race en route to her second consecutive title. 
Springsteadah, who finished in 21:09, saw two of her teammates trailing her and she knew Millville had reclaimed the team title it had lost to Vineland last season, snapping a stretch of seven straight championships for the program. 
“I’m proud of all of them for working hard,” Springsteadah said. “We couldn’t have done it without each other.” 
The Thunderbolts closed with 21 points, 17 better than Vineland, which took second with 38. Bridgeton was third with 82 and Cumberland placed fourth with 100.
